alert.note: Alert for West Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 09 at 8:01AM CST until November 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory this morning, freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch through midday. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations late tonight into Friday of 6 to 14 inches, with potential for small areas of higher amounts and ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, West Marshall County. In North Dakota, Eastern Walsh County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...For the advisory this morning, slick travel conditions are expected during the morning commute. For the watch tonight, widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...After the period of freezing rain this morning there should be a lull in winter impacts through early evening. For the watch period, uncertainty remains for the areas that could receive the heaviest snow and timing and coverage of freezing rain or sleet. This will create large spread in potential impacts, and the storm track could still shift.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
